page.title: 01Mortimer Gazetteer
page.content: The area consists of undulating countryside, mostly occupied by mixed farms rising over 90 metres in the N.W. to a ridge with gravel workings and pine plantations. This is the site of Mortimer. The village has a lively community. It has basic shops, primary schooling, primary health care, churches, and a wide range of voluntary communal activities. The village is dominated by red brick. Most of the buildings are of the last 100 years; Victorian around the centre and along the main roads, with later developments around the edges. The population continues to increase but development has been restricted to in- filling to preserve the rural environment. Traces of earlier occupation exist, notably remains of the Roman settlement of Silchester in the S.W. corner.
